Class InvertedIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • asn9.InvertedIndex

  • public class InvertedIndex
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      InvertedIndex(java.lang.String stopListName)
      This is the InvertedIndex constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDocument(Document d)
      Adds a new Document to the inverted index by mapping each word in that Document to a HashSet of Documents that includes the Document.
      void dumpIndex()
      Prints out each key/value pair in the inverted index.
      java.util.HashSet<Document> multiWordQuery(java.lang.String inputLine)
      This returns a HashSet of Documents that every String from the input can be found in.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InvertedIndex

        public InvertedIndex(java.lang.String stopListName)
        This is the InvertedIndex constructor. It initializes stoplist and index. The expected complexity is: O(1).
        Parameters:
        stopListName, - the name of the file to become a StopList

    • Method Detail

      • multiWordQuery

        public java.util.HashSet<Document> multiWordQuery(java.lang.String inputLine)
        This returns a HashSet of Documents that every String from the input can be found in. The expected complexity is: O(n).
        Parameters:
        inputLine, - the query made by the user, made up of multiple Strings
        Returns:
        HashSet of Documents that every String from inputLine is found in

      • dumpIndex

        public void dumpIndex()
        Prints out each key/value pair in the inverted index. The expected complexity is: O(n).

      • addDocument

        public void addDocument(Document d)
        Adds a new Document to the inverted index by mapping each word in that Document to a HashSet of Documents that includes the Document. The expected complexity is: O(n*m).
        Parameters:
        d, - the Document to be added
